values:
Oops.  I'm really bad about updating, aren't I?

Uhm.  Semester ended okay.  Did pretty well in all my classes, and even passed P Chem!  (With a whopping D, but you know what?  I FUCKING PASSED P CHEM, which is more than some people can say.)

Summer's been going well.  Visited Washington with Aaron, which was fun.  Washington is beautiful - but too cold.

As of right now, I've been living in Blacksburg for the summer.  Pissing a lot of friends off back home, and family, buuuut I'm happier down here and thats what counts.  Aaron and I moved in together and so far it's been wonderful ^^  He's a little messy, and it's lonely while he's at work, but other than that it's all good :D

I am happy right now.  Haven't been this happy in a long time.

I will try to do better about updating, perhaps...
http://miray722.livejournal.com/388174.html

My Drug Chem exam is on the same day as my P Chem exam.  My Drug Chem exam is going to make me extraordinarily brain dead for my  P Chem exam, and I must pass this exam to graduate next year.

I am so fucked.

Hello, panic attack?  Come back to say, have you?
http://miray722.livejournal.com/388033.html

I'm doing better than the last time I posted.  Maybe I just needed to get it out - and hell knows I've been doing a lot of that - or maybe my mood is extremely affected by weather more than normal, and the recent heat wave has done wonders for me.  Oh yeah, and I'm not being OMG overwhelmbed by school work for the first time in about a month.

Lisa is leaving me in May and I shall need to find a new roommate to replace her.  WIll be sad.  Aaron and I have discussed living together next year.  Despite most people telling me I shouldn't, I think it would work out well.  But the rent can be steepish (not near as steep as, say...in NoVa) and I'm not sure he can get the money for it.  We shall have to see, I suppose.

My cat is cute.  I have a newfound addiction for rice pudding that I blame very heavily on Lisa.  And I apparently have an interest in neurology.  That is all for now.
http://miray722.livejournal.com/387645.html

Ran late today for lab - printer problems and last minute project selections.  Lab ran from 10:10-1:30, then Diff Eq from 2:30 to about 4.  Mad dash home (spent the last of my money on groceries today) for food, and I was back on campus at 5:15 to meet Amy for P chem hw.  P chem hw from 5:30 (we walked cross campus for her dinner) to 7:30, walked back cross campus for the P. Chem review session from 8-9:15, then did P. Chem hw again.  Finally finished at about 1 am.  Dropped Sean off at his dorm and then got pulled over for speeding (32 in a 15 - guess it's a good thing she wasn't around when I was doing 42).  Made a mistake of laughing at the cop when she told me my court date (during Thanksgiving break, the bitch knew I wasn't going to be here to go to it) because. Well.  I was hysterical.  And when I'm hysterical, I laugh at the bad things.  And, yeah, that counted as a bad thing.  I felt bad, because Amy was dead on her feet and I was trying to get her home so she could get some sleep.

Fun lab story.  Involvting exploding glass separatory funnels, shooting stoppers, and fire.  Yeah, that was mostly it.

Oh.  I have Shakespeare hw....god dammit.

I'm going to dream fo delta S's and integrals of dT all night, I bet you anything.
http://miray722.livejournal.com/387250.html

Been a while.  Heh...busy?

Randomly, sschedule for this fall:

M/W:  Organic Syn-Tech Lab, 10:10-1:00
           Intro to Differential Equations, 2:30-3:45

T/Th:  Physical Chemistry, 9:30-10:45
           Intro to Britiish Lit, 12:30-1:45
           Shakespeare, 2:00-3:15
           Intro to American Lit, 3:30-4:45

Yes, I am generally completely and utterly literatured out by the end of T/Th.  Brit Lit is often times quasi-interesting, (we're doing early Brit Lit...middle ages to around the 1800s), and I mostly love Shakespeare.  But American Lit is extraordinarily boring.  And I hates it.

I'm getting to see Romeo and Juliet tomorrow by the American Shakespeare Company.  Apparently themed to Michael Jackson.  Wtf?  Should be interesting, for sure.

You know, I was gonna make this a longer entry.  But I actually have nothing to say.  Y'know...classes started again.  Life's the same as usual, I guess?




Chem lab was hokie spirited:  synthesis of methyl orange.  Yeah, we had a lot of fun Wednesday in lab.
http://miray722.livejournal.com/386355.html

This is slightly ridiculous.  I'll flirt with Ben or Phillip and they'll be like 'one day, Bri, this will be taken more seriously.'  And then I half panic, because I don't know if they really are serious.  I mean.  Mostly I doubt it.  But then I think I should be wishing they are.  And then I think, 'well, fuck.'

I am, as I have said tonight now, damaged goods.  Absolutely ruined for anybody else.  At least right now.  I fell hard for Matt, and while he's off and free and over me, I'm still sitting here pining and trying to patch my heart back up.  And if it ever does get patched back up, why the fuck do I want to go through that again?

Sometimes I just want to say 'you know what, I am serious,' and see if anything could go from there.  But I can't, because I'm still too much not over Matt.

...If you've got love in your sight, watch out.  Love bites.

On an entirely different note, summer is....odd.  Usually I'm very uptight at home.  But even though this summer hasn't been great, I've been very relaxed and chill through most of it.  It's unusual but refreshing.

...I have no idea what Helena is trying to do under my dressed O.o
http://miray722.livejournal.com/386232.html

A guy with alcohol should have his phone taken from him.  It plays havoc with girls' minds.

Life sucks.
http://miray722.livejournal.com/385933.html

I got a C in both Organic and Inorganic.  Life is good.  I got a B in lab.

...I do, however, have two huge bruises on my thighs that I have no fucking clue where they came from.  And they're really bad ones (well, the first has mostly healed.  The second I just now saw...tonight).  It sort of hurts, but only when I press on it.  You can pop blood vessels in your thigh without hitting yourself, right?

...Hmm.

(Actually, the longer I've realized I have it, the more it hurts v.v)

I can't wait for this weekend :D
http://miray722.livejournal.com/385655.html

Semester OVER :D Hopefully I will see Matt today, I have a job interview tomorrow, Kim comes down on Friday (I am extraordinarily pleased about that) and then we're going to an amusement park Saturday.  All and all, now that I've got my finals done, I'm a happy girl.

I think they may have all turned out okay. Okayish, anyway.  Physics, well. Lost cause. I'm sadly stuck in summer classes all summer. But what can you do, yeah?

...Okay, I was going to say more, but then I realized I'm on two hours of sleep with nothing to do for the rest of the day.  I'm going to take a nap.

PS: I had the ABC's stuck in my head all through my Organic oexam. Wtf?
http://miray722.livejournal.com/385527.html

C'mon Virginia. Give a little bit of leeway.

http://miray722.livejournal.com/384520.html

Semester is almost over....oy.

-Fischer Esterification lab report
-Sn1 and Sn2 lab report
-Finkelstein Formal lab report
-Ester hydrolysis lab report
-Reductions lab report
-Bromination lab report
-digital narrative must be finished soon (heh...yeah)
-organic problem (it's going to be a bitch)
-physics homework
-start studying for finals
-clean room (again)
-shopping and wasting money :D

Thats pretty much my plan for the weekend. Whee.

Life has been up and down.  I'm loving the pretty weather.  I've been missing Matt almost as if we just broke up again (maybe not that much, but I've been missing him more than I used to lately).  I'm stressed out about my classes -- Physics in particular.  I really want to get a C in that class. We'll see. I've been doing alright on the lab reports and quizzes, and I've done much better on the homework than I did the first half of the semester. My test scores are shit, though.  But maybe with a curve...maybe? v.v I bombed my three latest exams, which means hopefully I got that outta my system and will do alright on the finals. I usually pull through on the finals.Somehow.
http://miray722.livejournal.com/384436.html

Actually, I think i t's been one of those years, but lets not dwell, shall we?

I wash mashing pellets of KOH in a round-bottom flask today in lab, using a glass stir bar, and I guess I pressed to hard because I went right through the bottom. Managed to cut my fingers in a few place and get KOH in the cut a little. Had to flush it with water. Great fun.

The end of the year is so near... and yet I still have so much to do.

...I was going to write more. But. Uhm. Yeah, I'm tired and I have to get up in four hours for class. So I think I'm gonna go to bed instead.
http://miray722.livejournal.com/384113.html

I sort of feel like I need to say something in here, except that I don't really have anything to say. I've been very busy with school. Lots of Chemistry, a little bit of English thrown in.

I got a 52 on my last Inorganic exam. The average was a 41, so I'm sort of okay with this.

I got  a 60 on my last Organic exam. The average was a 59.5, so I'm still sort of okay with this (beats the 50 and 56 on the last exams I had...).

Also got a C- on my English paper, which beats the majority of F's my class got. This makes me smug. Perhaps somewhat too much. I just grin a lot when I think that a Chemistry major that hasn't written a paper in two years still managed to get a higher grade than the majority of her classmates, who are all primarily or solely English majors. I know, I don't need to be boosting my ego anymore :D

Also managed to get two full Physics hw assignments done, and a few quizzes done without cheating too much.

All in all, it's been sort of productive with school.

I did manage to lose my check card, so I've been using my credit card, which I hate doing, but I don't have much of a choice right now, I suppose. Lisa's cat is in heat and has been sort of driving me crazy for the past week. I really like Cheese, just...not when she's yowling constantly. It's quite irritating. But, she's getting spayed on the 20th, soooo good for me!

I think I might go to bed now and dream of Chemistry or Physics, most likely. It seems to be happening a lot.

PS: The flowers are blooming and the sun's been out (except yesterday, with the freakish snow) and it all makes me really happy. I never appreciated how beautiful Blacksburg was last Spring.
http://miray722.livejournal.com/383666.html

Last night I had to take Estella in to the emergency vet and I left her there for overnight observation. She had two seizures, and a sort of freak out. Bloodwork and outward appearances are fine, so they don't know what's wrong. I hope she's okay. She's a bitch, but she's my bitch.

Anyway, I also have a physics exam tonight I am completely not ready for....gah. One more grade attempt down the drain.
http://miray722.livejournal.com/383162.html

I have to take an 8-hour god damn 'driving improvement' class. And no, it can't be done online. I have to go in to a class for eight hours. Has anyone seen me pay attention to something for more than half an hour? It doesn't happen. Just doesn't.

All because that stupid COCKSUCKING GOD DAMN BITCH HAD TO PULL THE FUCK OVER IN FRONT OF ME SO I HIT HER AND I TAKE THE GOD DAMN FUCKING BLAME.  Because I took my lawyers advice and didn't fight the ticket because he said it wouldn't matter. BECAUSE MY LUCK SUCKS.

The class also charges a $75 fee, which is UTTER. BULLSHIT. After having to pay the ticket and putting out $3000 for my car alone, not to mention however much it was for her car.

It's all HER fucking fault, and I'm the one who is taking the blame.

Life. Fucking. Sucks.

(This continues the trend of me being royally screwed over by other people.)

On a different, equally shitty note, my babysitter's husband is dying. I liked him. I don't remember them much, but I liked him.
http://miray722.livejournal.com/382929.html

Spring Break started out very very well. Saturday was a lot of fun. I went tanning, which I missed, and then had an excellent bath. Kim, Phillip, and I then went out to Bush Hill Elementary to attempt to play softball (we were rather bad at it, but it was very funny, and we actually did manage to hit a few balls), and then came back to my house to play Sorry on the porch because it was so nice out. We then got milkshakes, and played Uno, and then while Kim and Timmy were being outside being dramatic, Phillip and I played Go Fish. Yeah. Go Fish. I'm not joking. The four of us then played another game of Sorry while waiting for Victor, and then when he said he was too tired to come over, we showed Kim Repo! The Genetic Opera, and she was somewhat hooked. So all in all, that was a good day. 

I very much want to go to a theme park. I'm in the mood for rollar coasters. Today is perfect. It's not too hot, but nice and windy. A bit on the cool side, but when you're walking around in the sun, chilly is good. It means you're not willing to wait for an hour just to get on a water ride.

On a very different note:

Caida722 (1:18:31 AM): heyya matt?
Matt(1:18:39 AM): yesh?
Caida722 (1:18:45 AM): whyd you break up with me?
Matt(1:19:04 AM): haven't i already told you?
Caida722 (1:19:13 AM): sort of
Caida722 (1:20:05 AM): i guess i just want to clarify?
Matt(1:20:48 AM): welll, prob the same reasons
Caida722 (1:20:58 AM): ...can you name then?
Matt(1:22:02 AM): do i really have to :\
Caida722 (1:22:15 AM): ...well, i guess you don't have to if you really don't
Matt(1:22:26 AM): i mean, i don't really see the reason or the need
Caida722 (1:22:26 AM): *don't want to
Caida722 (1:22:36 AM): because i was talking to kim and it just got me to thinking
Caida722 (1:22:48 AM): i was never in a rational state of mind when havig those conversations with you
Matt(1:23:25 AM): i see
Caida722 (1:23:43 AM): you don't have to
Caida722 (1:23:45 AM): not a big deal, i guess
Matt(1:23:49 AM): yeah


That pissed me off a bit last night. He never gives me straight answers. Even when I ask direct questions, he either dances around a real answer, or does that and avoids answering completely. It's very annoying. I went along with it, but I was kind of annoyed for the rest of the night. The most I remember of why he broke up with me was that 'he was sometimes unhappy, and didn't feel that I respected him.' I kinda feel that needs clarification. I don't know, maybe I'm alone in thinking that.

Whatever. I'ts a gorgeous day, so I'm going to take another bath :) and get ready to be out in it.
http://miray722.livejournal.com/382544.html

I just saw my O. Chem Exam 2 grade.  And now I kinda want to throw myself off a cliff.

I have officially tanked on every exam given this semester. And frankly, I'm a little disgusted with myself.
http://miray722.livejournal.com/382187.html

Watching a girl tell Matt they should hook up sometime, and then the teacher joke that he's the most eligable bachleor made me see red. Green-red actually, because I was jealous and pissed enough at the same time that I actually had to leave the room. They weren't even serious, and yet the whole thing had me crying for the next hour or so.

...I am so pathetic. I a) have no right to be jealous and b) even if I did, they were just joking.

...I just don't want to think what might've happened if it hadn't been joking v.v
http://miray722.livejournal.com/381807.html

This week is starting out markedly better than last week. Two hour delay (which cancelled three of my classes: my 8 am, and my 9 am, and then my 12:20 recitation because a 9 am recitation was cancelled, thus cancelling all recitations). And here I went to bed thinking 'stop snowing, you're not helping me!'

Bwahahaha!

The cancellation of my recitation gives me some time to go back to my apartment and get food in me,  so I don't die of starvation in the middle of my Syn-Tech lab, without having to cross the Drillfield!

This completely helps me ignore the fact I got a 57% on the last exam :D
http://miray722.livejournal.com/381453.html

So, I have reestablished my hate for groupwork and relying on other people.

I was supposed to meet with my homework group for O. Chem ater class on Friday. Mind you, I didn't choose these guys, we were assigned. They both e-mailed and said 'yeah, sure, we can meet after class.' Guess what? Neither of them showed up. And then on Saturday, we did the homework, finally, and they both revealed they never go to class. Some surprise that. We finish the homework. On Monday, the homework is turned in.

Except on Wednesday, my group member comes in and says 'the homework was due today, wasn't it?' No, fucktard. the homework was fucking due Monday. So, our professor said he'd give us 50%. The answers were right.  We could've had 100%. But no, we go a 50% because the fucking group member that said he would turn it in didn't show up to class.

And this is partly my fault, because I should have known better than to trust an almost stranger with my grade. I should've had my own copy and turned it in just be sure. But I'm kind of dumb like that.

And then lab ran over an hour, because our dumb professor gave us a lab that was too damn long to actually due in the alotted six hours we have for the day days of lab. Instead, very few people finished, and I only finished because I stayed an extra hour to do it, because I had nothing else to do.

Nothing else to do except for the English midterm. That was long, tedious,and  mindnumbingly boring. And I stayed up until 4 am to do it - although admitted, part of that was my fault, but I wasn't really complaining much about how late I stayed up. I then got up this morning at 8:30 because I tried to get the bathroom before Lisa, because we both use it at more or elss the same time on Thursdays.  Therefore, I got to campus a good 45 mintues early, which was cool because it allowed me to find a parking spot much easier than I normally can. Except then I had to wat around for a good 40 minutes for class to start. Whatever, no biggie. Until some stranger comes in, asks: "Is this Bob Canter's class?" and when we say 'yes' he says 'it was cancelled.'

Cancelled! I go up at fuckign 8:30 am, stayed up until 4 fucking up, for no fucking reason other than to show up to a class for it to be fucking cancelled with no notice. People are like 'at least it was cancelled!' I don't care! if I'm going to go through all that effort of dragging myself out of bed, shower, and getting on campus early, then  I damn well better have what I got up for! Even if it is an extraordinarily dull class.

...Needless to say, I kinda hate anything school related at the moment, and have reassured myself that you really can't rely on anyone but yourself.

On the bright hand, I played Left 4 Dead to calm myself down. And there is something very therapeutic about playing a zombie, tackling someone, and just sitting there ripping them to shreds while his teammates leave them there to die :D  I think my laughter was actually rather maniacal. Oh well.

Now, I could be a good girl, and do homework in the rest of this free day. Will I? Nah.
http://miray722.livejournal.com/381228.html

OMG, two posts in one day.

I heard something today that made me laugh a little. I was half-napping in my Critical Reading class (after two A's back on quizzes...haven't seen grades that high all year) - when the girl behind me was talking about how much work she had to. I found out the girl she was talking to was a double major, and the conversation went something like this:

Girl 1: I can't wait to get out of this class. I have one more class today and then I get to start my four day weekend.
Girl 2: Oh, man, lucky. I'd like one of those.
Girl 1: Yeah, but I do have a lot of work to do. So if that makes you feel any better...
Girl 2: Yeah, a little bit. I have some work to do, but don't want to stay up too late because I have to get up at 8 am for my two morning Comm classes.
Girl 1: Oh, that sucks. What are you majoring in?
Girl 2: English and Communications.
Girl 1: Oh, wow, you're a double major. Good luck with that. (I feel the need to mention that the Comm and English majors overlap a lot in their credits so it's extremely easy to get them both done in a decent aount of time.) I'm just an English major, I don't even have a minor. ~laughs~

And then she went on to talk about how everyone says English is an easy major when it's not, and compared it to engineers. And I just wanted to laugh. I like English (clearly, since I'm double majoring in it). I have respect for English majors. But I will never be convinced that English is anymore than a mediumly difficult major, at most. The liberal arts are different from the sciences because if you like something in the liberal arts, it's easy enough to do well (except maybe Art. I love art, but I know I'm not particularly good at it). The sciences - well, even if you like it, you're lucky to be seeing B's.

I feel like this makes me sound a little condensending towards English majors. And I can't lie, I think I am a little bit. If that's what you like, go for it, but I just can't believe it's particularly difficult. Might be a lot of work (Lord knows I'm not looking forward to any of the 10 page papers I'm going to have to write), but hard? No. Particularly not if it's by itself.

Who knows, maybe I'll change my mind when I fail some English class in the future :D
http://miray722.livejournal.com/381108.html

I find this kinda neat.

Professor Carlier was my Organic professor last semester. I wasn't a huge fan of his teaching style, but I've had worse. As someone who actually takes antidepressants, I guess I just find it kind of neat to see my teacher had been working on a project like this.

In a not so neat sense, I have a really bad cough and my nose hurts from running so much v.v Lovely cold. I also have an Inorganic exam on Tuesday, and I jsut had one last week. Thank you for that, Professor Deck. You are cool, but not cool enough to give two tests so close together >.<

Ta, I need to get to class.
http://miray722.livejournal.com/380879.html

So, I woke up with a slight hangover and to listening to people have sex. Admitted, they were being quiet and so I'm not very annoyed with them, but I think it's fair to say it's an irritating situation and did not lead to a good start of Valentine's Day. After finally managing to drag myself out of bed, Matt asks me to lunch. I, of course, get my hopes up (thankfully not as much as I may have once had - I didn't even cry today! I guess I'm learning). In the process of getting ready to go meet him, I developed a sore throat. That quickly progressed from an ache to OMGKNIFEDEATHOW. Yeah, it sucked. And then lunch with him was fun - sans sore throat - and he was really sweet. For instance, he said he wasn't really hungry but he just wanted to spend some time with me. How do you stay mad and distant from someone like that? >.<

Anyway, the rest of the day was kind of blah. My throat got worse and I didn't really do much.

Oh, and Audrey and Cat showed me Repo man: The Genetic Opera last night, and now I'm vaguely obsessed with about half the soundtrack. Some pretty awesome music there, and one of the first reasons to respect Paris Hilton (she does a great job in that movie). Only disappointment was the song with Shilo and her dad fighting about allowing Mag to stay wasn't on the song - which I find odd, because it was one of the better ones and a decent length. Ah well.

Anyhoo. A big THANK YOU to Kristen, Phillip, and Ben (even though only Kristen reads this...lol) for making my Valentine's Day not a completely disaster. It could very well have been plain boring without you.

Despite their help, I felt a bit lonely for a decent bit of it. I feel like I'm losing two of my best friends, and all we're doing is pretending that things are fine. I'm not sure how to stop it. v.v

PS: I got a 53% on my first Organic exam, but the class average was a 64%, so I don't really feel horrible about this Still, kinda sucky start of the semester's grades.
http://miray722.livejournal.com/380595.html

Shit that WILL get done before Friday night rolls around:

-Prelab and procedure for TLC Syn-Tech lab
-Inorganic Exam
-Physics Exam
-Organic Exam
-Physics prelab
-English quiz
-Lab report for Recrystaization/Melting Point lab

Shit that SHOULD get done before Friday (but likely will not because...I am lazy):

-Physics hw
-Distillation lab report started
-My room REALLY needs cleaned
-Studying for the exams (I'll try, I really will...)
-Finalize draft of my resume
-...Find my sanity?

Can I just go to sleep and never wake back up? v.v

Approximately this time two years ago, Mom had to take me to the emergency room because I tried to kill myself. I felt completely unwanted - as if nothing I did was right, there was no future for me, and the world would be better off without me in it. I was literally drowning in unhappiness and uncertainty, and didn't feel like I could stand another day.

I look back at that time now, and I'm grateful Mom came in and found me that night. I don't know if my overdose would have worked - but I think it would have. I'd never felt quite that way before, as thought my heart had stopped. I don't really remember what the doctors said, but it doesn't really matter, I guess.

I still often feel unwanted and unhappy. I still feel now the way I did then. But the difference is, I don't want to end my life over it. I don't know when that changed or why. I still backslide sometimes. I've cut - recently - and tried to drown myself in alcohol or pills. But never once did I want to try and take my life again. The thought has crossed my mind, I suppose, but then I realize only a moment later that it's not what I want. I want to hang in there and keep trying. Even after Matt pretty much ripped my heart out, I wanted to keep hanging in there.

I, uhm....don't know where I was going with this entry. I guess this time just brings back a lot of memories. Being home at this time brings back even more memories. I was just thinking about it, and thinking how I've changed. I don't think I'm much happier now than I was then, but maybe I'm more optimistic? Or determined. I don't know. I guess I just realized there are people who would miss me - and opportunities I could have that I'd miss out on. I suppose curiosity for the future overrode the terror and certainty that I'll have a horrible future.

I'm shushing now, because I don't think this entry made much sense. I'm tired, cramping, and I have a headache. Makes me a little on the non-sensical side.

This has not been a good week. And it's only Tuesday...er, it is Wednesday now, isn't it?

I haven't been sleeping well. Too many vivid dreams, a lot of them decently upsetting so that I wake up. Sadly enough, they're about Matt not wanting me or failing my lab reports or classes.

Which is, not surprisingly, exactly whats been plaguing my mind for ages. I got a 56% on my O Chem exam, knocking me down to a second class with a D as my grade. I even tried. I really tried. I just couldn't get it all straight.

Now I'm doing a lab report on Biochem. Biochem. I'm not a fucking Biochem major. I don't know what the hell a Michaelis Constant is or turnover number. I've been trying to understand it since Friday, but this is apparently something I can't teach myself. I went to my TA and she didn't do a very good job at explaining it either - and I don't blame her. She hasn't done Biochem in years, she said, and we're not doing this in class. We're doing chromatography in class. Dr. Morris is out of town, so it's not like I can go ask my real professor who assigned us the god damn lab, and our TA cancelled recitation today, so there's another potential source that went out the window. I'm completely lost, and this is a formal report, meaning it's worth double the amount of all our other labs. And i have no idea what it's on! I can manipulate the numbers and get answers, but I don't know what that means in terms of significance.

And then, of course, there's Matt. Who I am so fucking tired of missing him. I'm tired of hurting and I want to stop. But you can't just turn emotions on and off. I'm trying. I've been trying. There's like an ache in my chest that just won't go away. And he doesn't want me. I know he doesn't want me. You'd think I'd be able to come to terms with that and get over it. Ten months of pure utter bliss - out the drain! Bye bye! Doesn't seem to matter. He, apparently, can just stop loving someone when he wants to. Makes me feel like maybe he never loved me at all.

And it sucks, because when I'm with him, it doesn't matter all that much. I'm not really all that upset. I could be flipping out all day and then if I see him, it's not so bad. I feel a little bit better. Ironic, really, since generally he's what made me upset in the first place. Maybe classes.

I'm just so tired of trying, and then fall flat on my face anyway. I keep on trying anyway, hoping one day I'll get it right, but I just keep hurting in the meantime...


On a more amusing note, if not happier, do you think it would be detrimental to my grade sending Dr. Morris a big 'FUCK YOU' for assigning us this lab report?

“Samantha Otey to isle five, please. Samantha Otey to isle five.”

                The store was packed with people, the lines on all twenty-five registers going back to the rows of goods the store was selling. It was crowded and noisy – obvious people were doing their last-minute shopping before the holidays. Kids ran around in excitement, screaming about god-knew-what with their mothers chasing after them frantically, trying to get them in order. Couples wandered around holding hands and giggling to each other, and the entire place was cheerful despite the chaos.

                Andrew Johnson was not immune to the happiness, but he really did want to get out and get back to his apartment. He still had a lot of work to do tonight, and hadn’t eaten for most of the day, so he would like to get some food in him soon. All the same, he stood patiently in front of the display of flowers, trying to pick out which he thought his girlfriend Anne would like best and ignoring his basket that was beginning to get a little heavy.

                The thought of Anne and her curly blond hair and infectious laugh brought a smile to his face. They’d been dating for two years, as of tomorrow; to celebrate their two-year anniversary, he was out buying a bouquet of flowers and planned to take her out to a fancy restaurant that everyone had been raving about and she’d been dying to try. He was hoping they could go back to his place afterwards and spend some alone time, so he’d kindly asked his roommate to find somewhere else to be tomorrow night. His roommate had laughed and agreed, telling Andrew to have a great time.

                It seemed everything was falling in place and despite his hurry to get home, he couldn’t wipe the grin off his face. Anne made him incredibly happy and he loved every opportunity he had to let her know how he felt. In return, she made all sorts of arrangements with her crazy schedule to make time to see him as often as she could. She was sweet and thoughtful, with a thousand jokes and a smile she reserved just for him. He honestly thought he could spend the rest of his life with her, but…well…two years seemed a little soon to be considering marriage when they were only twenty-four. He’d give it more time before thinking further on that train of thought.

                Tearing his mind away from his girl – sort of, anyway – he went back to studying the flowers. He remembered her saying she loved roses, so he picked a healthy bouquet of striped roses that were a deep red. He smelled them once and smiled a bit, liking the strong scent they were giving off. He hoped she would like them.

                Walking away from the display and towards the registers, he reached in his pocket for his wallet. The lines were still ridiculously long, even the express ones, so he picked a random one closest to the display and began to wait. He absently looked at the cheap magazine covers, headlining everything from political debates to rumors on bad plastic surgery, and of course the gossip on the celebrities. He never took these seriously, but they were at least amusing to look at while he was waiting. And judging by the woman in front of him who had a ridiculous amount of things on the conveyor, he felt this could take a while. Did she really need to buy that much, honestly?

                His thoughts wandered for about ten minutes while he waited, and finally the woman was halfway checked out when his phone in his pocket buzzed. Juggling his basket of groceries and the roses, he picked up and smiled at the name. Anne.

                “Hey, babe.”

                “Hi, Andrew.”

                “What’s up?”

                “Nothing. I just wanted to talk to you for a second. What you doing?”

                “Just standing in line at the store. I should be out of here soon.”

                “Oh, that’s good.”

                “Yeah. Are you sure there’s nothing you want to talk about? You sound a little off.”

                “Well. Kind of. Can I see you later tonight?”

                He blinked in surprise. While he loved seeing her, they both had insane schedules and tried to plan at least a day ahead when they were going to go out. He thought of mountain of paperwork on his desk at home and winced. “I’m sorry, babe, I really am, but I have a lot of work to do tonight. Is it… important?”

                “Well…I guess I can just tell you now.”

                “Sure, whatever’s on your mind.”

                “The thing is, Andrew, I haven’t been feeling right with us lately.” He felt a cold stone drop in his stomach at that statement, and opened his mouth to say something but she continued on hurriedly, as if she knew he would disagree. “And by lately, I mean a couple of months. I met a guy at work, Jake, and I really like him. He asked me out yesterday, and I want to go. But I didn’t want to without telling you first.”

                “…Telling me what, exactly, Anne? What are you telling me?” He knew what she was saying, but didn’t want to believe it. When had this begun happening? He thought he would feel something falling apart before he heard this conversation.

                “That it’s over, Andrew. I’m sorry. I was happy with you, but I haven’t been lately. Jake’s a great guy, and I think he’s worth giving a chance.”

                “A chance? We have two years…and… you want… a chance?”

                “I’m sorry. Goodbye, Andrew.”

                She didn’t give him a chance to say anything else, but hung up. He stared numbly at his phone for a second. The person behind him must have caught something of the conversation, because they sent him a vaguely sympathetic look and then looked away as if they were crossing a line.

                Andrew realized he was in public. He set his basket down out of the way and put his phone away, slowly as if he were in a trance – everything seemed dreamlike, but ‘dream’ implied something positive, or at least not horrific. This was beyond a nightmare, one that he wished he’d wake up from, screaming and sweating perhaps, but knowing it wasn’t real. But it was.

                He looked at the red roses in his hand, realizing suddenly that he no longer needed them. Tears threatened to fall as it slowly began to sink in, and he felt that an icy hand was gripping his lungs and he wasn’t able to breathe; it caused a physical pain that spread through his chest, and up his throat. He suddenly felt a desperate need to get out, get to at least his car, because there were too many people here – he couldn’t break down yet. He didn’t want to go back to the flower display, so he hastily shoved the flowers in the magazine rack and rushed out. He didn’t feel himself moving, but knew he must have, because he soon found himself in his car, tires screeching as he sped his way out of the parking lot, narrowly missing a few pedestrians and other cars.

                His mind wasn’t coming to grips with it. He hadn’t awoken this morning expecting his life to come crashing down like this. He hadn’t seen any signs – maybe they’d seen each other a little less, but that was to be expected with their busy schedules. He didn’t understand why it had to happen like this. How could a three-minute conversation cause this much pain?

                He tried calling her back when he reached his apartment. Not that he was coherent now anyway, but it didn’t matter, because she didn’t pick up. He knew she never would again.

Vito is not necessarily a bad city. It actually has quite a few high points that make it welcoming and even pleasant. It’s close to the coast, on the edge of Domani, and the fact that it’s small doesn’t detract from the very urban setting. There are a lot of tall, modern buildings, roads that are actually intact, and somewhat pretty vegetation throughout that make the place fairly decent. And despite the slightly harsh winters, the summers are incredible weather, with pretty much no humidity to speak of.

                It’s just that unfortunately in my job, you don’t always remember these charming details of Vito. Working at night and making a living through murder begins to force you into your own personal hell, and the outside world of pleasant Vito is just a teenage memory. You could probably blame that on me, I suppose. I don’t make much of an effort to remind myself of Vito’s nicer side, and none of my colleagues really do either. It’s a personal preference, I guess, to stay in our own world.

                I work in the Night Watch. Twelfth squad, to be specific, and I vary between second and third in command. My squad is technically one of the two ‘special operations’ squad, but really we’re mostly just like the other ten squads. We deal with the supernatural of the city – vampires, werewolves, umbri, invisi, and the like. They attack someone, and we answer the call and do damage control. Or sometimes cause the damage at time, though we really try not to. We also go after clans and raid their territory to try and clean out as many as possible. In our free time, we work diligently on developing cures, or at least suppressants, for the genes that turn humans into these creatures. We haven’t been successful, yet, but some of the discoveries we’ve made have been immensely helpful in battle. For instance, who knew it’s not just werewolves that are allergic to silver?

                Mostly my team is called in for battle, though. We’re smart enough to work in the labs, but given my team’s skill, we’re generally thrown out in the streets instead. Generally we find the most dangerous mission of the night. Yeah, it sounds like a bit of a killjoy, but I kind of like it that way. I enjoy living on the edge. It makes every day mean something extra, every friend I make – however few and far between they are – a little more special. I guess you could say it’s given me a slightly different outlook on life, though that certainly wasn’t my intention when joining. Funny how life works out that way; it’s always full of surprises.

I asked mom to get me an appointment with my psychologist when I go home this weekend.

And now I possibly feel like the silliest person alive. Except not. Everyone makes fun of the people who can't get over their ex, who want to talk to professionals about it, until they're in that position. I couldn't understand Kim when Jeremy broke up with her and she tried to kill herself. I tried to support her, be there for her in whatever way I could, but I didn't understand. It didn't make sense to me how someone felt their life was over just because their significant other broke up with them.

Well now I'm in that position. Perhaps not so dramatic. I don't necessarily feel like my life is over. I even know that - one day - I'll probably be happy again. But right now? It's really really hard to believe that. My friends tell me I need to 'just get over it.' I'm trying, I REALLY am trying. But it's not so easy. I would if I could, because that would make my life SO much easier. I'd like my heart and brain to stop arguing. To stop warring between pessimism and optimism. Why don't emotions listen to you?

Kristen pegged it today. I think it hurts more because Matt seems to be doing so much better with it all, which makes me sometimes feel like he doesn't love me, and maybe didn't love me. Not as much as I did him anyway. And she said it. 'He had a choice.' He chose to break it, and so hes doing better. I guess I'm a little self-absorbed. I don't think how it might hurt him; maybe I just don't know because he doesn't show me. Or maybe he really is okay. I'm not sure.

But, yeah. I partially feel kind of silly wanting to see my psychologist about this, and partially think maybe I'm actually being responsible to try and get real help to get over it. I don't really know, but I'm gonna go ahead and do it anyway.

Now I just need to think what to tell her.
By the way, What Hurts the Most by Rascal Flatts is an AWFUL song to listen to when you're dealing with a breakup. Sad, since it's so damn pretty.

To quote Xander, from Buffy: "I'll go home, and listen to country - the music of pain."

So, Thursday afternoon I started crying merely because Matt didn't want to have dinner with me. This sounds pretty pathetic - is pretty pathetic - but it does kind of hurt knowing he'd rather eat dinner with someone he lives with than me, when he only sees me maybe three times a week. Then I think, well of course he probably doesn't want to see me, because I am his crazy ex-girlfriend that is prone to bursting into tears and asking him why the hell he thought it was necessary to break up with me.

I wonder if this would hurt less if he would stop telling me he still loves me. Because when he says he loves me, I still have hope. And having hope crushed continuously is actually more hurtful than having your heart broken and then given time to move on with life. Instead, I'm left wondering 'he says he loves me, so maybe one day...' and I keep hoping for that 'one day' but I know it will never come.

And then he says something stupid like 'Never say never' and then I want to hope again. So then I wonder if I should tell him to stop telling me that, except that because of that stupid thing called 'hope,' I never get the balls to tell him.

Its been two months and four days since I rejoined the single community of the world, and the pain hasn't dulled a bit. I would have thought it had, but I still can't get over him. It sucks.

I don't know who I'd like to lash out at. I'd like to alsh out at him, but I don't think it's his fault. I don't really know if I what I did justifies this pain I'm in, though. I know I fucked up - repeatedly - but this seems a bit harsh.

And then I take my happy pills. Despite the utterly godawful fucking migraine it's giving my (my seratonin is like 'WTF? Why are we getting bumpd around so much?!) I do feel better. Or at least more numb. Kinda sucks I have to take this little pink pill just to make myself feel not so crushingly hopeless and just more 'meh.'
